Description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau took action against Republic Mortgage Insurance Corporation (RMIC), for allegedly paying illegal kickbacks to mortgage lenders in exchange for business. The CFPB filed a complaint and proposed consent order against RMIC to stop these practices, which have been prevalent for more than 10 years. The proposed order required RMIC to pay a $100,000 penalty to the CFPB.

Private Litigation Case Title: Erickson et al v. Old Republic Title Company et al

Description: In a case brought by the San Francisco City Attorney and District Attorney, Old Republic was ordered to pay over $5 million in judgment of allegations it illegally kept interest from escrow bank accounts.

Company: Old Republic Title Co. and Old Republic National Title Insurance Co.

Description: Fine levied for giving producers of title insurance business reports containing publically recorded information about one or more parcels of real property without charging for and actually receiving payment for same and by advertising or promoting the listings of real property for sale by real estat...
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Fine levied for providing evidence of title or a copy of the contents of a document which is not produced or issued by the title company without charging for such documents. RCW 48.17.560; WAC 284-29-260(6)(f)
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Old Republic agreed to pay nearly $300,000 to insurance regulators in Minnesota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania and Utah to resolve issues relating to its travel insurance policies.

Description: Old Republic, one of the largest title insurance companies, agreed to terminate its no-poaching agreements with other employers and pay $1 million to New York State.
